thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Rollback
A strategy of seeking modest changes to the 2010 Dodd-Frank financial law—agreed to in private by Senate Banking Committee Chairman Mike Crapo and Gary Cohn, then President Trump’s top economic adviser—paid dividends Tuesday as Congress passed a rare bipartisan bill. The measure to ease crisis-era restrictions on small and midsize banks passed the House with support from 33 Democrats, after passing the Senate with 17 Democratic votes in March, and now advances to President Trump for his expected signature....
